pullRequest.title: NXP-29564 : Add use of FSExporter with collections

nodes.bodyText: Could you add a javadoc with a @since 11.4 line?
This file is missing its Copyright header.

Could you make your fields protected?
Note: we're used to only use protected and public visibilities.
According to the java convention naming, names such as these ones are for constants and not for inside method variable.
Not needed and not accurate, the document path is /default-domain/workspaces/testWorkspace.

You could use the Blobs helper:
Blobs.createBlob("some content", "text/plain", "UTF-8", "My_File_In_Section.txt");
Can you add a new line at the end of the file?

nodes.bodyText:
I'm not a fan of collectingAndThen here @kevinleturc. I find it more readable to write
List<DocumentModel> docs = collection.getAdapter(Collection.class)
                                     .getCollectedDocumentIds()
                                     .stream()
                                     .map(IdRef::new)
                                     .map(session::getDocument)
                                     .collect(Collectors.toList());
return new DocumentModelListImpl(docs);

But if we inline this in the caller we don't even need the DocumentModelListImpl or the Collectors.toList.
This doesn't need to be a method in the FSExporterPlugin interface. Just inline the actual implementation into its caller, in FSExporter.export in the if statement.

nodes.bodyText:
Let's be fully functional:
String path = serialized.getAbsolutePath();
doc.getAdapter(Collection.class)
   .getCollectedDocumentIds()
   .stream()
   .map(IdRef::new)
   .map(session::getDocument)
   .forEach(collected -> serializeStructure(session, path, collected, PageProvider));

And remove unneeded imports.
